maieutic method.definition: A method of teaching by question and answer; it was used by Socrates to elicit truths from his students; -- called also the Socratic method

maieutics.definition: The art of giving birth (i. e., clearness and conviction) to ideas, which are conceived as struggling for birth

maigre.definition: Belonging to a fast day or fast; as, a maigre day

maikel.definition: A South American carnivore of the genus Conepatus, allied to the skunk, but larger, and having a longer snout. The tail is not bushy

maikong.definition: A South American wild dog (Canis cancrivorus); the crab-eating dog

mail.definition: A small piece of money; especially, an English silver half-penny of the time of Henry V
A flexible fabric made of metal rings interlinked. It was used especially for defensive armor
Hence generally, armor, or any defensive covering
A contrivance of interlinked rings, for rubbing off the loose hemp on lines and white cordage
Any hard protective covering of an animal, as the scales and plates of reptiles, shell of a lobster, etc

The bag or bags with the letters, papers, or other matter contained therein, conveyed under public authority from one post office to another; the whole system of appliances used by government in the conveyance and delivery of mail matter
That which comes in the mail; letters, etc., received through the post office
A trunk, box, or bag, in which clothing, etc., may be carried
To deliver into the custody of the postoffice officials, or place in a government letter box, for transmission by mail; to post; as, to mail a letter

mail call.definition: A call of the names of those persons receiving mail for the purpose of transmitting mail to them; -- a technique used in the military services to deliver mail to enlisted personnel

mail car.definition: A  railway car of special design used for the transportation and sorting of mail en route to its destination, and having employees of the post office inside to perform those functions

mail carrier.definition: A person who delivers the mail; -- also called a letter carrier.  A male mail carrier is also called a mailman
synonyms: Syn. -- postman, letter carrier, carrier, mailman.

mail clerk.definition: A clerk in a post office

mail fraud.definition: The use of the mails to defraud someone

mail slot.definition: A usually horizontal slot in a door through which mail can be delivered.  It often has a hinged cover to keep the opening cloised when not in use

mail train.definition: A railroad train that carries mail

mail-order buying.definition: The buying and selling of goods to be shipped from the vendor through the mail to the purchaser.  Information about to be purchased may be found in catalogs, advertisements, on the web, etc., and purchase orders transmitted to the vendor by mail, telephone, or internet connection

mailable.definition: Admissible lawfully into the mail.  Opposed to non-mailable.  Dangerous items such as explosives, weapons, or corrosive chemicals are often classified by the postal authorities as non-mailable

mailbag.definition: A bag in which mailed matter is conveyed or shipped under public authority
A letter carrier's shoulder bag; as, in England they call a mailbag a postbag

mailboat.definition: a boat that carries the mail
synonyms: Syn. -- mail boat, packet, packet boat.

mailbox.definition: A public box for deposit of mail, where it is later picked up by the postal authority for delivery

A private box to recieve delivery of mail.  The term is used both for boxes receiving mail delivered by the public postal authority, or by a private services, such as for mail to employees in large corporations

A location within a computer storage device where electronic mail is held until it is retrieved by the addressee.  Creation and use of an electronic mailbox requires special software as well as a data storage device

mailclad.definition: Protected by a coat of mail; clad in armor

mailed.definition: Protected by an external coat, or covering, of scales or plates

mailing.definition: The act or process of sending materials through the mail
A quantity of mail, such as letters, magazines, advertising brochures, etc., sent at one time by one person or organization; as, the ads with coupons will go out in our next mailing

mailing address.definition: The postal address where a maile can be addressed to a person or organization

mailing list.definition: A list of names and addresses to which advertising, solicitations of money, or other materials material sent in large quantities is mailed; -- it is usually used by comercial or charitable organizations.  Mailing lists are often sold by organizations to other organizations, and are frequently used for targeted mailing, i. e., mailing to groups of people who are more likely htan the general population to respond as desired to the message in the mail

mailman.definition: A man who delivers the mail.  A male mail carrier
synonyms: Syn. -- postman, mail carrier, letter carrier, carrier.

mailsorter.definition: A machine that sorts mail, according to the address

maim.definition: To deprive of the use of a limb, so as to render a person in fighting less able either to defend himself or to annoy his adversary
To mutilate; to cripple; to injure; to disable; to impair
The privation of the use of a limb or member of the body, by which one is rendered less able to defend himself or to annoy his adversary
The privation of any necessary part; a crippling; mutilation; injury; deprivation of something essential. See Mayhem

main.definition: A hand or match at dice
A stake played for at dice
The largest throw in a match at dice; a throw at dice within given limits, as in the game of hazard
The chief or principal part; the main or most important thing
The great sea, as distinguished from an arm, bay, etc. ; the high sea; the ocean
Principal; chief; first in size, rank, importance, etc.; as, the main reason to go; the main proponent

main course.definition: The principal part of a meal

main deck.definition: The uppermost sheltered deck that runs the entire length of a large vessel

main entry word.definition: The form of a word that heads a lexical entry and is alphabetized in a dictionary; also called entry word, headword, and lemma
synonyms: Syn. -- citation form, entry word, headword, lemma.

main file.definition: A file that is used as the authority in a given job and that is relatively permanent

main line.definition: Ahe principal route of a transportation system, such as a railroad or bus line

main memory.definition: The memory in a computer that holds programs and data for rapid access during execution of a program; it usually hold the largest quantity of rapid-access storage in a computer; -- also called RAM (random access memory.  It is contrasted to ROM, disk data storage, cache, registers and other forms of data storage

main office.definition: The office that serves as the administrative center of an enterprise,
synonyms: Syn. -- headquarters, central office, home office.

main road.definition: A major road for any form of motor transport

main rotor.definition: The assembly of large rotating airfoils (blades) on a helicopter that produce the lift to support the helicopter in the air

main sequence.definition: That region on a two-dimensional graph of luminosity versus temperature for stars (the Herzsprung-Russel diagram), which runs from high temperature and high luminosity to low temperature and low luminosity, in which most of the stars (plotted as points on the diagram) are found.  A normal star such as the earth's sun will spend most of its time over billions of years within this region of temperature and luminosity, as it progressively converts more of its original hydrogen into heavier elements.  After the hydrogen is consumed, a star may become a red giant or evolve into other types of star not within the main sequence region

main street.definition: A main thoroughfare, usually one in a small town having the largest concentration of retail businesses
The attitudes, environment, or life style of a small town; -- usually capitalized, and often used attributively; as, Main Street attitudes toward Washington

main yard.definition: The yard on which the mainsail is extended, supported by the mainmast

main-gauche.definition: The dagger held in the left hand, while the rapier is held in the right; -- used to parry thrusts of the adversary's rapier

main-hamper.definition: A hamper to be carried in the hand; a hand basket used in carrying grapes to the press

main-topmast.definition: the mast next above the mainmast

main-topsail.definition: a topsail set on the mainmast

maine.definition: One of the New England States

maine lobster.definition: Any of several cold-water lobsters with large tender claws, caught from Maine to the Carolinas
A lobster (Homarus americanus) found off the Atlantic coast of North America
synonyms: Syn. -- American lobster, Northern lobster, Homarus americanus.

mainframe.definition: A large digital computer serving 100-400 users and occupying a special air-conditioned room.  At any given point in development of computer technology, the mainframe will be faster, have large main memeory, and be more capable than a minicomputer, which will in turn be faster and more capable than a personal computer.  The typical personal computer in 1999 is faster than a mainframe was in 1970
The board holding the CPU and the memory forming the central part of a computer to which the peripherals are attached

mainland.definition: The continent; the principal land; -- opposed to island, or peninsula

mainland china.definition: The People's Republic of China, also called Communist China, in distinction from Nationalist China, the government located on the island of Taiwan.  Both governments claim to represent the entire people of China, but the People's republic is recognized as China by the United Nationss and most of its member states

mainline.definition: to inject (illegal drugs) into the vein; as, he preferred to mainline heroin rather than sniff coke

mainly.definition: Very strongly; mightily; to a great degree

mainmast.definition: The principal mast in a ship or other vessel

mainor.definition: A thing stolen found on the person of the thief

mainpernable.definition: Capable of being admitted to give surety by mainpernors; able to be mainprised

mainpernor.definition: A surety, under the old writ of mainprise, for a prisoner's appearance in court at a day

mainprise.definition: A writ directed to the sheriff, commanding him to take sureties, called mainpernors, for the prisoner's appearance, and to let him go at large. This writ is now obsolete
To suffer to go at large, on his finding sureties, or mainpernors, for his appearance at a day; -- said of a prisoner

mains.definition: The farm attached to a mansion house; a manse
The source of electrical power in a building; the wiring system of a building

mainsail.definition: The principal sail in a ship or other vessel

mainsheet.definition: One of the ropes by which the mainsail is hauled aft and trimmed

mainspring.definition: The principal or most important spring in a piece of mechanism, especially the moving spring of a watch or clock or the spring in a gunlock which impels the hammer

mainstay.definition: The stay extending from the foot of the foremast to the maintop

mainstream.definition: The prevailing opinion or practise; as, the doctor avoided using therapies outside the mainstream of modern medical practice
TO place (a student) in regular school classes; -- used especially of mentally or physically handicapped children

mainstreamed.definition: Placed in regular school classes; -- of the handicapped

maintain.definition: To hold or keep in any particular state or condition; to support; to sustain; to uphold; to keep up; not to suffer to fail or decline; as, to maintain a certain degree of heat in a furnace; to maintain a fence or a railroad; to maintain the digestive process or powers of the stomach; to maintain the fertility of soil; to maintain present reputation
To keep possession of; to hold and defend; not to surrender or relinquish
To continue; not to suffer to cease or fail
To bear the expense of; to support; to keep up; to supply with what is needed
To affirm; to support or defend by argument

maintainor.definition: One who, not being interested, maintains a cause depending between others, by furnishing money, etc., to either party

maintenance.definition: The act of maintaining; sustenance; support; defense; vindication
That which maintains or supports; means of sustenance; supply of necessaries and conveniences
An officious or unlawful intermeddling in a cause depending between others, by assisting either party with money or means to carry it on. See Champerty
Those actions required for the care of machinery, a building, etc., to keep it clean and in proper functioning condition, and to prevent or forestall damage due to normal use
Payments, such as child support or alimony, to a dependent child not living with one or to a divorced wife

maintenance man.definition: A worker, usually in an enterprise or apartment building, whose job is to repair damaged parts of a building or its fixtures, and sometimes to make improvements or other changes to the building

maintenance staff.definition: Those persons in a business responsible for maintaining the physical plant in good condition

maintop.definition: The platform about the head of the mainmast in square-rigged vessels

maioid.definition: Of or pertaining to the genus Maia, or family Maiadeae

maitre d'hotel.definition: The manager or owner of a hotel

maize.definition: A large species of American grass of the genus Zea (Zea Mays), widely cultivated as a forage and food plant; Indian corn, commonly called corn.  Also, its seed, growing on cobs, and used as food for men and animals

synonyms: Syn. -- European spider crab, king crab, Maja squinado.

majagua.definition: A shrubby tree (Hibiscus tiliaceus) widely distributed along tropical shores, which yields a light tough wood used for canoe outriggers and a fiber used for cordage and caulk; it is often cultivated for ornament
synonyms: Syn. -- mahoe, mahagua, balibago, purau, Hibiscus tiliaceus.

majagua.definition: An erect forest tree (Hibiscus elatus) of Cuba and Jamaica having variably hairy leaves and orange-yellow or orange-red flowers; it yields a moderately dense timber for cabinetwork and gunstocks
synonyms: Syn. -- Cuban bast, blue mahoe, mahoe, mahagua, Hibiscus elatus.

majestic.definition: Possessing or exhibiting majesty; of august dignity, stateliness, or imposing grandeur; lofty; noble; grand

majesticness.definition: The quality or state of being majestic

majesty.definition: The dignity and authority of sovereign power; quality or state which inspires awe or reverence; grandeur; exalted dignity, whether proceeding from rank, character, or bearing; imposing loftiness; stateliness; -- usually applied to the rank and dignity of sovereigns
Hence, used with the possessive pronoun, the title of an emperor, king or queen; -- in this sense taking a plural; as, their majesties attended the concert
Dignity; elevation of manner or style

majidae.definition: A natural family comprising the spider crabs

majolica.definition: A kind of pottery, with opaque glazing and showy decoration, which reached its greatest perfection in Italy in the 16th century

major.definition: Greater in number, quantity, or extent; as, the major part of the assembly; the major part of the revenue; the major part of the territory
Greater by a semitone, either in interval or in difference of pitch from another tone
An officer next in rank above a captain and next below a lieutenant colonel; the lowest field officer

That premise which contains the major term. It its the first proposition of a regular syllogism; as: No unholy person is qualified for happiness in heaven [the major]. Every man in his natural state is unholy [minor]. Therefore, no man in his natural state is qualified for happiness in heaven [conclusion or inference]

major axis.definition: The greater axis of a geometrical figure

major diatonic scale.definition: The natural diatonic scale, which has semitones between the third and fourth, and seventh and eighth notes, and whole tones between the other notes;  the scale of the major mode, of which the third is major; also called major scale.   See Scale, and Diatonic

major form class.definition: Any of the parts of speech of traditional grammar

major general.definition: An officer of the army holding a rank next above that of brigadier general and next below that of lieutenant general, and who usually commands a division or a corps

major leaguer.definition: A member of a major-league baseball team

major power.definition: A nation powerful enough to influence events throughout the world
synonyms: Syn. -- world power, great power, power.

major premise.definition: That premise of a syllogism that contains the major term (which is the predicate of the conclusion).  Contrasted to minor premise

major suit.definition: A suit of playing cards which has higher scoring value; specifically, either spades or hearts.  Contrasted with a minor suit, being either diamonds or clubs

major term.definition: That term of a syllogism which forms the predicate of the conclusion

major-domo.definition: A man who has authority to act, within certain limits, as master of the house; a steward; also, a chief minister or officer

major-league.definition: Of or pertaining to a major league; as, major-league football rules
Among the best or most important of its class; as, a major-league computer manufacturer

major-league club.definition: A sports team that plays in a major league

majorana.definition: A small genus of herbs usually included in the genus Origanum

majorat.definition: The right of succession to property according to age; -- so termed in some of the countries of continental Europe
Property, landed or funded, so attached to a title of honor as to descend with it

majorate.definition: The office or rank of a major

majority.definition: The quality or condition of being major or greater; superiority
The greater number; more than half; as, a majority of mankind; a majority of the votes cast

The amount or number by which one aggregate exceeds all other aggregates with which it is contrasted; especially, the number by which the votes for a successful candidate exceed those for all other candidates; as, he is elected by a majority of five hundred votes. See Plurality

majority leader.definition: The leader of the majority party in a legislature.  Compare minority leader

majority rule.definition: The rule or doctrine that the numerical majority{2} of an organized group can make decisions binding on the whole group; as, our club makes decisions by majority rule..  Contrasted with unanimous consent, or decision by a decree of a single person or small committee forming part of an organization

majors.definition: The teams in the major leagues

majusculae.definition: Capital letters, as found in manuscripts of the sixth century and earlier

majuscule.definition: A capital letter; especially, one used in ancient manuscripts. See Majusculae

makalu.definition: A mountain in Nepal and Tibet, 27,824 feet high

make.definition: A companion; a mate; often, a husband or a wife
To cause to exist; to bring into being; to form; to produce; to frame; to fashion; to create
To produce, as something artificial, unnatural, or false; -- often with up; as, to make up a story

To bring about; to bring forward; to be the cause or agent of; to effect, do, perform, or execute; -- often used with a noun to form a phrase equivalent to the simple verb that corresponds to such noun; as, to make complaint, for to complain; to make record of, for to record; to make abode, for to abide, etc
To execute with the requisite formalities; as, to make a bill, note, will, deed, etc

To find, as the result of calculation or computation; to ascertain by enumeration; to find the number or amount of, by reckoning, weighing, measurement, and the like; as, he made the distance of; to travel over; as, the ship makes ten knots an hour; he made the distance in one day
To cause to be or become; to put into a given state verb, or adjective; to constitute; as, to make known; to make public; to make fast
To cause to appear to be; to constitute subjectively; to esteem, suppose, or represent
To require; to constrain; to compel; to force; to cause; to occasion; -- followed by a noun or pronoun and infinitive

To become; to be, or to be capable of being, changed or fashioned into; to do the part or office of; to furnish the material for; as, he will make a good musician; sweet cider makes sour vinegar; wool makes warm clothing
To compose, as parts, ingredients, or materials; to constitute; to form; to amount to; as, a pound of ham makes a hearty meal
To be engaged or concerned in
To reach; to attain; to arrive at or in sight of
To act in a certain manner; to have to do; to manage; to interfere; to be active; -- often in the phrase to meddle or make
To proceed; to tend; to move; to go; as, he made toward home; the tiger made at the sportsmen
To tend; to contribute; to have effect; -- with for or against; as, it makes for his advantage
To increase; to augment; to accrue
To compose verses; to write poetry; to versify
Structure, texture, constitution of parts; construction; shape; form

make and break.definition: Any apparatus for making and breaking an electric circuit; a circuit breaker

make believe.definition: To pretend; -- often used with that, but often having the that omitted; as, he made believe he didn't hear her; or he made believe that he didn't hear her

make known.definition: To reveal; to disclose; as, the congressman made known his interest in the company only after he voted on the bill

make-belief.definition: A feigning to believe; make believe

make-believe.definition: A feigning to believe, as in the play of children; a mere pretense; a fiction; an invention
Imaginary; as, the child had a make-believe friend to whom he often talked

make-game.definition: An object of ridicule; a butt

make-work.definition: Active work of litle value, such as assignments given by teachers to students to keep them busy while the teacher performs other tasks, or chores performed to while away time; also called busywork

makebate.definition: One who excites contentions and quarrels

maker.definition: One who makes, forms, or molds; a manufacturer; specifically, the Creator
The person who makes a promissory note
One who writes verses; a poet

makeshift.definition: That with which one makes shift; a temporary expedient, with implication of inferiority to the more usual object or means

makeup.definition: The way in which the parts of anything are put together
The constituent parts of anything; as, the makeup of the new congress was predominantly conservative
Cosmetics applied to the face, such as lipstick, facial power, or eye shadow
The aggregate of cosmetics and costume worn by an actor
The effect or appearance of the wearing of makeup (in senses 3 or 4); often, the way in which an actor is dressed, painted, etc., in personating a character; as, her makeup was very realistic
An action that is taken to fulfill a requirement not accomplished at the expected time, such as a make-up examination; as, the student took his make-up on Saturday
The appearance of a page of a publication, specifically the type style of the text and the spatial arrangement of the text, illustrations, advertising material etc., on the page
The art or process of arranging the portions of a printed publication on the pages for esthetic reasons or for optimal effect on the reader

makeweight.definition: That which is thrown into a scale to make weight; something of little account added to supply a deficiency or fill a gap

making.definition: The act of one who makes; workmanship; fabrication; construction; as, this is cloth of your own making; the making of peace or war was in his power
That which establishes or places in a desirable state or condition; the material of which something may be made; as, early misfortune was the making of him

making-iron.definition: A tool somewhat like a chisel with a groove in it, used by calkers of ships to finish the seams after the oakum has been driven in

making-up.definition: The act of bringing spirits to a certain degree of strength, called proof
The act of becoming reconciled or friendly

mako shark.definition: A powerful and fierce mackerel shark of the Atlantic and Pacific, of the family Lamidae

makomako.definition: A graceful deciduous shrub or small tree (Aristotelia serrata) having attractive foliage and small red berries that turn black at maturity and are used for making wine
synonyms: Syn. -- New Zealand wine berry, wineberry, Aristotelia serrata, Aristotelia racemosa.

maksutov telescope.definition: A type of reflecting telescope in which the aberration of the concave mirror is reduced by a meniscus lens

mal de mer.definition: Motion sickness experienced while traveling on water; seasickness

mal-.definition: A prefix in composition denoting ill, or evil, F. male, adv., fr. malus, bad, ill.  In some words it has the form male-, as in malediction, malevolent. See Malice

mala.definition: Evils; wrongs; offenses against right and law

malabar.definition: A region in the western part of the Peninsula of India, between the mountains and the sea

malabar kino.definition: The reddish or black juice or resin from certain trees of the genus Pterocarpus, used in medicine and tanning etc
synonyms: Syn. -- East India kino, kino gum.

malacanthidae.definition: A natural family of short-headed marine fishes which are often brightly colored

malacca.definition: A town and district upon the seacoast of the Malay Peninsula

malacca cane.definition: A walking cane made from the stem of a species of palm of the genus Calamus (Calamus Scipionum), and of a brown color, often mottled. The plant is a native of Cochin China, Sumatra, and Malays

malachite.definition: Native hydrous carbonate of copper, usually occurring in green mammillary masses with concentric fibrous structure

malacissation.definition: The act of making soft or supple

malacobdella.definition: A genus of nemertean worms, parasitic in the gill cavity of clams and other bivalves. They have a large posterior sucker, like that of a leech. See Illust. of Bdellomorpha

malacoderm.definition: One of a tribe of beetles (Malacodermata), with a soft and flexible body, as the fireflies

malacologist.definition: One versed in the science of malacology

malacology.definition: The science which relates to the structure and habits of mollusks

malacopoda.definition: A class of air-breathing Arthropoda; -- called also Protracheata, and Onychophora

malacopterygii.definition: An order of fishes in which the fin rays, except the anterior ray of the pectoral and dorsal fins, are closely jointed, and not spiny.  It includes the carp, pike, salmon, shad, etc. Called also Malacopteri

malacosteon.definition: A peculiar disease of the bones, in consequence of which they become softened and capable of being bent without breaking

malacostomous.definition: Having soft jaws without teeth, as certain fishes

malacostraca.definition: A subclass of Crustacea, including Arthrostraca and Thoracostraca, or all those higher than the Entomostraca

malacostracology.definition: That branch of Zoological science which relates to the crustaceans; -- called also carcinology

malacozoa.definition: An extensive group of Invertebrata, including the Mollusca, Brachiopoda, and Bryozoa. Called also Malacozoaria

malacozoic.definition: Of or pertaining to the Malacozoa

maladdress.definition: Bad address; an awkward, tactless, or offensive way of accosting one or talking with one

maladministration.definition: Bad administration; bad management of any business, especially of public affairs

maladroit.definition: Of a quality opposed to adroitness; clumsy; awkward; unskillful

malady.definition: Any disease of the human body; a distemper, disorder, or indisposition, proceeding from impaired, defective, or morbid organic functions; especially, a lingering or deep-seated disorder
A moral or mental defect or disorder

malaga.definition: A city and a province of Spain, on the Mediterranean.   Hence, Malaga grapes, Malaga raisins, Malaga wines

malagasy.definition: A native or natives of Madagascar; also (sing.), the language

malagasy republic.definition: Former name of the Republic of Madagascar, a nation in Africa occupying the island of Madagascar in the Indian Ocean east of Mozambique

malaise.definition: An indefinite feeling of uneasiness, or of being sick or ill at ease

malambo.definition: A yellowish aromatic bark, used in medicine and perfumery, said to be from the South American shrub Croton Malambo

malamethane.definition: A white crystalline substance forming the ethyl salt of malamic acid

malamic.definition: Of or designating an acid intermediate between malic acid and malamide, and known only by its salts

malamide.definition: The acid amide derived from malic acid, as a white crystalline substance metameric with asparagine

malanders.definition: A scurfy eruption in the bend of the knee of the fore leg of a horse. See Sallenders

malapropism.definition: A grotesque misuse of a word; a word so used

malapropos.definition: Unseasonable or unseasonably; unsuitable or unsuitably

malapterurus.definition: A genus of African siluroid fishes, including the electric catfishes. See Electric cat, under Electric

malapterurus electricus.definition: The species name of the electric catfish, a freshwater catfish of the Nile and tropical central Africa having an electric organ

malar.definition: Of or pertaining to the region of the cheek bone, or to the malar bone; jugal
The cheek bone, which forms a part of the lower edge of the orbit; that arch of bone beneath the eye that forms the prominence of the cheek; also called the malar bone
synonyms: Syn. -- cheekbone, zygomatic bone, malar bone, jugal bone, os zygomaticum.

malaria.definition: Air infected with some noxious substance capable of engendering disease; esp., an unhealthy exhalation from certain soils, as marshy or wet lands, producing fevers; miasma

A human disease caused by infection of red blood cells by a protozoan of the genus Plasmodium, giving rise to fever and chills and many other symptoms, characterized by their tendency to recur at definite and usually uniform intervals.  The protozoal infection is usually transmitted from another infected individual by the bite of an Anopheles mosquito

malaria mosquito.definition: A mosquito that transmits the malaria parasite; it is most commonly the Anopheles mosquito

malaria parasite.definition: Any of several minute protozoans of the genus Plasmodium (syn. Haematozoon) which in their adult condition live in the tissues of mosquitoes of the genus Anopheles (which see) and when transferred to the blood of man, by the bite of the mosquito, produce malaria

malarial.definition: Of or pertaining, to or infected by, malaria

malassimilation.definition: Imperfect digestion of the several leading constituents of the food

malawi kwacha.definition: The kwacha, the monetary unit of Malawi

malax.definition: To soften by kneading or stirring with some thinner substance

malaxation.definition: The act of softening by mixing with a thinner substance; the formation of ingredients into a mass for pills or plasters

malaxator.definition: One who, or that which, malaxates; esp., a machine for grinding, kneading, or stirring into a pasty or doughy mass

malaxis.definition: A large genus of largely terrestrial orchids with one or a few plicate leaves and slender spikes or tiny mostly green flowers; it is cosmopolitan

malaxis-unifolia.definition: A North American orchid having a solitary leaf and flowers with threadlike petals
synonyms: Syn. -- green adder's mouth, Malaxis ophioglossoides.

malay.definition: One of a race of a brown or copper complexion in the Malay Peninsula and the western islands of the Indian Archipelago
Of or pertaining to the Malays or their country

malay archipelago.definition: A group of islands in the Indian and Pacific Oceans between Asia and Australia

malay peninsula.definition: a peninsula in Southeastern Asia occupied by parts of Malaysia and Thailand and Burma

malaya.definition: Formerly, an Asian country on Borneo and the Malay Peninsula, now part of Malaysia

malayalam.definition: The name given to one the cultivated Dravidian languages, closely related to the Tamil

malayan tapir.definition: A large inoffensive chiefly nocturnal ungulate (Tapirus indicus) of tropical America and Southeast Asia having a heavy body and fleshy snout

malaysia.definition: A country in Southeast Asia including the former nation of Malaya on the Malay Peninsula, and part of Borneo; sometimes still referred to as Malaya

malaysian.definition: Of or pertaining to or characteristic of Malaysia or its people or their culture; as, Malaysian police cracked down hard on drug smugglers; Malaysian poetry

malbrouck.definition: A West African arboreal monkey (Cercopithecus cynosurus)

malcolm little.definition: A militant American black nationalist leader, also called Malcolm X; (1925-1965)

malcolm stock.definition: Any of various ornamental flowering plants of the genus Malcolmia

malcolmia.definition: A genus of plants usually found in coastal habitats; native from the Mediterranean to Afghanistan

malconformation.definition: Imperfect, disproportionate, or abnormal formation; ill form; disproportion of parts

malcontent.definition: discontented; uneasy; dissatisfied; especially, dissatisfied with the government
One who discontented; especially, a discontented subject of a government; one who expresses his discontent by words or overt acts

maldanian.definition: Any species of marine annelids of the genus Maldane, or family Maldanidae.  They have a slender, round body, and make tubes in the sand or mud

maldive islands.definition: A group of about 2000 islands in the Indian ocean; also known as the Maldives

maldivian.definition: A native or inhabitant of Maldives

maldon.definition: A battle in which the Danes defeated the East Saxons in 991; it is celebrated in an old English poem

male.definition: Of or pertaining to the sex that begets or procreates young, or (in a wider sense) to the sex that produces spermatozoa, by which the ova are fertilized; not female; as, male organs
Capable of producing fertilization, but not of bearing fruit; -- said of stamens and antheridia, and of the plants, or parts of plants, which bear them
Suitable to the male sex; characteristic or suggestive of a male; masculine; as, male courage
Consisting of males; as, a male choir
Adapted for entering another corresponding piece (the female piece) which is hollow and which it fits; as, a male gauge, for gauging the size or shape of a hole; a male screw, etc
An animal of the male sex
A plant bearing only staminate flowers

male body.definition: The body of an adult human male; -- a term used especially in art; as, Da Vinci was unexcelled in painting the male body
synonyms: Syn. -- adult male body, man's body.

male chauvinism.definition: Disparaging, patronizing, discriminatory or abusive speech or behavior by males toward females stemming from a belief that males are superior to females and females therefore worthy of less respect and inferior treatment.  A form of sexism

male chauvinist.definition: A man with a belief in the inferiority of women; one who believes in or practises male chavinism

male fern.definition: A fern of North America and Europe (Dryopteris filix-mas) whose rhizomes and stalks yield an oleoresin used to expel tapeworms.  It is a member of the woodfern genus

male orchis.definition: A Eurasian orchid (Orchis mascula) with showy pink or purple flowers in a loose spike
synonyms: Syn. -- early purple orchid, Orchis mascula.

male orgasm.definition: An orgasm in a male animal accompanied by the ejaculation of semen

male plug.definition: The connecting end of the cord on an electrical device, having two or three pins, that is inserted into a matching socket to make an electrical connection

male-spirited.definition: Having the spirit of a male; vigorous; courageous

maleberry.definition: A deciduous much-branched shrub (Lyonia ligustrina) with dense downy panicles of small bell-shaped white flowers; also called swamp andromeda
synonyms: Syn. -- privet andromeda, he-huckleberry, Lyonia ligustrina.

maleberry.definition: A kind of coffee. See Pea berry

malebranchism.definition: The philosophical system of Malebranche, an eminent French metaphysician.  The fundamental doctrine of his system is that the mind can not have knowledge of anything external to itself except in its relation to God

malediction.definition: A proclaiming of evil against some one; a cursing; imprecation; a curse or execration; -- opposed to benediction

malefaction.definition: A crime; an offense; an evil deed

malefactor.definition: An evil doer; one who commits a crime; one subject to public prosecution and punishment; a criminal
One who does wrong by injuring another, although not a criminal.  Opposite of benefactor

malefic.definition: Doing mischief; causing harm or evil; nefarious; hurtful

maleficent.definition: Doing evil to others; harmful; mischievous

maleficience.definition: The doing of evil, harm, or mischief

maleic.definition: Pertaining to, or designating, an acid of the ethylene series (maleic acid), metameric with fumaric acid and obtained by heating malic acid

maleic acid.definition: An unsaturated dicarboxylic acid (HO.CO.CH=CH.CO.OH) of cis conformation, having various uses in the manufacture of artificial resins, the dyeing and finishing of wool, silk, and cotton, and also combined with certain drugs to make salts more soluble than the basic forms.  The corresponding isomer having trans conformation, is identical in chemical formula, is called fumaric acid

maleo.definition: A bird of Celebes (megacephalon maleo), allied to the brush turkey. It makes mounds in which to lay its eggs

malevolence.definition: The quality or state of being malevolent; evil disposition toward another; inclination to injure others; ill will. See Synonym of Malice

malevolent.definition: Wishing evil; disposed to injure others; rejoicing in another's misfortune

maleyl.definition: A hypothetical radical derived from maleic acid

malfeasance.definition: The doing of an act which a person ought not to do; evil conduct; an illegal deed

malformation.definition: Ill formation; irregular or anomalous formation; abnormal or wrong conformation or structure; -- often used of body parts such as limbs which do not develop properly during fetal maturation

malheur wire lettuce.definition: A small mustardlike plant (Stephanomeria malheurensis) of Oregon, belonging to the family Cruciferae; it is a threatened species

mali franc.definition: The standard monetary unit in Mali and some other countries

malian.definition: Of or pertaining to Mali; as, Malian deserts
of or pertaining to the inhabitants of Mali; as, Malian nomads
A native or inhabitant of Mali

malic.definition: Pertaining to, or obtained from, apples; as, malic acid

malice.definition: Enmity of heart; malevolence; ill will; a spirit delighting in harm or misfortune to another; a disposition to injure another; a malignant design of evil

Any wicked or mischievous intention of the mind; a depraved inclination to mischief; an intention to vex, annoy, or injure another person, or to do a wrongful act without just cause or cause or excuse; a wanton disregard of the rights or safety of others; willfulness
To regard with extreme ill will

malicious.definition: Indulging or exercising malice; harboring ill will or enmity
Proceeding from hatred or ill will; dictated by malice; as, a malicious report; malicious mischief
With wicked or mischievous intentions or motives; wrongful and done intentionally without just cause or excuse; as, a malicious act

malicious mischief.definition: Malicious and willful destructionof or injury to the property of others; -- it is an offense at common law

malign.definition: Having an evil disposition toward others; harboring violent enmity; malevolent; malicious; spiteful; -- opposed to benign
Unfavorable; unpropitious; pernicious; tending to injure; as, a malign aspect of planets
To treat with malice; to show hatred toward; to abuse; to wrong; to injure
To speak great evil of; to traduce; to defame; to slander; to vilify; to asperse

malignance.definition: The state or quality of being malignant; extreme malevolence; bitter enmity; malice; disposition toward evil; intense ill will; as, malignancy of heart
Virulence; tendency to a fatal issue; as, the malignancy of an ulcer or of a fever
A cancerous tumor that is spreading beyond the point of origin
synonyms: Syn. -- malignant tumor, malignant neoplasm, metastatic tumor.

malignance.definition: The state of being a malignant

malignant.definition: Disposed to do harm, inflict suffering, or cause distress; actuated by extreme malevolence or enmity; virulently inimical; bent on evil; malicious
Characterized or caused by evil intentions; pernicious
Tending to produce death; threatening a fatal issue; virulent; as, malignant diphtheria
A man of extreme enmity or evil intentions
One of the adherents of Charles I. or Charles II.; -- so called by the opposite party

malignant anemia.definition: A chronic progressive anemia of older adults, thought to result from a lack of intrinsic factor (a substance secreted by the stomach that is responsible for the absorption of vitamin B-12); also called pernicious anemia

malignant melanoma.definition: Any of several malignant neoplasms (usually of the skin) consisting of melanocytes; called also melanoma.  It is classed as a type of skin cancer

synonyms: Syn. -- malignancy, malignance, malignant tumor, metastatic tumor.
Syn. -- malignancy, malignance, malignant tumor, metastatic tumor.

malignity.definition: The state or quality of being malignant; disposition to do evil; virulent enmity; malignancy; malice; spite
Extreme evilness of nature or influence; perniciousness; heinousness; as, the malignity of fraud

malignly.definition: In a malign manner; with malignity

malinger.definition: To act the part of a malingerer; to feign illness or inability

malingerer.definition: In the army, a soldier who feigns himself sick, or who induces or protracts an illness, in order to avoid doing his duty; hence, in general, one who shirks his duty by pretending illness or inability

malingery.definition: The spirit or practices of a malingerer; malingering

malkin.definition: A mop made of clouts, used by the kitchen servant
A mop or sponge attached to a jointed staff for swabbing out a cannon

mall.definition: A large heavy wooden beetle; a mallet for driving anything with force; a maul
An old game played with malls or mallets and balls. See Pall-mall
A place where the game of mall was played. Hence: A public walk; a level shaded walk
To beat with a mall; to beat with something heavy; to bruise; to maul
Formerly, among Teutonic nations, a meeting of the notables of a state for the transaction of public business, such meeting being a modification of the ancient popular assembly
A public access area containing a promenade for pedestrians; as, to gather near the Washington monument on the mall in Washington
The paved or grassy strip between two roadways

A shopping area with multiple shops and a concourse for predominantly or exclusively pedestrian use; in cities the concourse is usually a city street which may be temporarily or permamently closed to motor vehicles; in suburban areas, a mall is often located on a convenient highway, may be large, contained in one building or in multiple buildings connected by (usually covered) walkways.  Also called shopping mall

mallard.definition: A drake; the male of Anas boschas
A large wild duck (Anas boschas) inhabiting both America and Europe.  The domestic duck has descended from this species.  Called also greenhead

malleability.definition: The quality or state of being malleable; -- opposed to friability and brittleness

malleable.definition: Capable of being extended or shaped by beating with a hammer, or by the pressure of rollers; -- applied to metals
Capable of being influenced to behave as desired; tractable; -- used mostly of children

malleate.definition: To hammer; to beat into a plate or leaf

malleation.definition: The act or process of beating into a plate, sheet, or leaf, as a metal; extension by beating

mallee.definition: A dwarf Australian eucalypt with a number of thin stems springing from a thickened stock.  The most common species are Eucalyptus dumosa and Eucalyptus Gracilis
Scrub or thicket formed by the mallee

mallee bird.definition: The leipoa, or Australian moundbird; it incubates eggs naturally in sandy mounds.  See Leipoa
synonyms: Syn. -- mallee fowl, mallee-fowl, leipoa, lowan, Leipoa ocellata.

mallee hen.definition: The adult female of the mallee fowl (Leipoa ocellata).  See Leipoa

malleolar.definition: Of or pertaining to the malleolus; in the region of the malleoli of the ankle joint

malleolus.definition: A projection at the distal end of each bone of the leg at the ankle joint. The malleolus of the tibia is the internal projection, that of the fibula the external
“ A layer, ” a shoot partly buried in the ground, and there cut halfway through

mallet.definition: A small maul with a short handle, -- used esp. for driving a tool, as a chisel or the like; also, a light beetle with a long handle, -- used in playing croquet

malleus.definition: The outermost of the three small auditory bones, ossicles; the hammer. It is attached to the tympanic membrane by a long process, the handle or manubrium. See Illust. of Far
One of the hard lateral pieces of the mastax of Rotifera. See Mastax
A genus of bivalve shells; the hammer shell

mallophaga.definition: An extensive group of insects which are parasitic on birds and mammals, and feed on the feathers and hair; -- called also bird lice. See Bird louse, under Bird

mallotus.definition: A genus of small Arctic fishes. One American species, the capelin (Mallotus villosus), is extensively used as bait for cod

mallow.definition: A genus of plants (Malva) having mucilaginous qualities. See Malvaceous

mallow family.definition: The natural family Malvaceae, a dilleniid dicot family consisting of herbs and shrubs and some trees, and including the mallows, cotton, and okra

mallowwort.definition: Any plant of the order Malvaceae

malm.definition: A kind of brick of a light brown or yellowish color, made of sand, clay, and chalk

malma.definition: A spotted trout (Salvelinus malma), inhabiting Northern America, west of the Rocky Mountains; -- called also Dolly Varden trout, bull trout, red-spotted trout, and golet

malmsey.definition: A kind of sweet wine from Crete, the Canary Islands, etc

malnourished.definition: Not getting adequate food; suffering from malnutrition; underfed

malnutrition.definition: Faulty or imperfect nutrition; inadequate or unbalanced food intake

malodorous.definition: Offensive to the sense of smell; ill-smelling

malodorousness.definition: The attribute of having a strong offensive smell

malonic.definition: Pertaining to, or designating, a dicarboxylic acid produced artifically as a white crystalline substance, CH2.(CO2H)2, and so called because obtained by the oxidation of malic acid

malonyl.definition: A divalent diacyl radical, CH2.(CO)2, from malonic acid

malonylurea.definition: A white crystalline acid derived from pyrimidine; it is used in preparing barbiturate drugs

malope.definition: A Western Mediterranean annual (Malope trifida) having deep purple-red flowers subtended by three large cordate bracts

malosma.definition: A genus having only one species; often included in the genus Rhus

malpais.definition: The rough surface of a congealed lava stream

malpighia.definition: A genus of tropical American shrubs with opposite leaves and small white or reddish flowers. The drupes of Malpighia glabra (formerly Malpighia urens) are eaten under the name of Barbadoes cherries

malpighia glabra.definition: THe species name of the acerola, also called barbados cherry, a tropical American shrub bearing edible cherrylike acid red fruit
synonyms: Syn. -- barbados cherry, acerola, Surinam cherry, West Indian cherry.

malpighiaceous.definition: Of, pertaining to, or resembling, a natural order of tropical trees and shrubs (Malpighiaceae), some of them climbing plants, and their stems forming many of the curious lianes of South American forests

malpighian.definition: Of, pertaining to, or discovered by, Marcello Malpighi, an Italian anatomist of the 17th century

malpighian body.definition: The capsule that contains a glomerulus at the expanded end of a nephron; also called malpighian corpuscle and Malpighian capsule

malpighian layer.definition: The innermost layer of the epidermis

malposed tooth.definition: A tooth that has grown in a faulty position

malpractice.definition: Evil practice; illegal or immoral conduct; practice contrary to established rules; specifically, the treatment of a case by a surgeon or physician in a manner which is contrary to accepted rules and productive of unfavorable results

malt.definition: Barley or other grain, steeped in water and dried in a kiln, thus forcing germination until the saccharine principle has been evolved. It is used in brewing and in the distillation of whisky
Relating to, containing, or made with, malt
To make into malt; as, to malt barley
To become malt; also, to make grain into malt

malt liquor.definition: An alcoholic drink made with malt

malt whiskey.definition: A whiskey distilled in Scotland (esp. whiskey made from malted barley in a pot still); Scotch whisky

malta.definition: A country on the island of Malta
An island south of Sicily in the Mediterranean Sea

malta fever.definition: An infectious disease contracted from meat or milk products from infected domestic animals; called also brucellosis and undulant fever

maltase.definition: An enzyme, α-D-glucosidase, which hydrolyzes maltose with production of glucose, and also hydrolyzes certain other α-D-glucosides

malted milk.definition: A milkshake made with malt powder; also called simply a malted
A powder made of dried milk and malted cereals

maltese.definition: Of or pertaining to Malta or to its inhabitants

maltese cat.definition: A short-haired bluish-gray breed of the domestic cat

maltese cross.definition: A Eurasian garden perennial (Lychins chalcedonica) having scarlet flowers in dense terminal heads
A cross with triangular or arrow-shaped arms and the points toward the center. See illustration under cross

maltese dog.definition: A breed of toy dog having a long straight silky white coat; also called a Maltese

maltha.definition: A variety of bitumen, viscid and tenacious, like pitch, unctuous to the touch, and exhaling a bituminous odor

malthus.definition: Thomas Robert Malthus, an English economist who argued that increases in population would outgrow increases in the means of subsistence (1766-1834)
synonyms: Syn. -- Thomas Malthus, Thomas Robert Malthus.

malthusian.definition: Of or pertaining to the political economist, the Rev. T. R. Malthus, or conforming to his views; as, Malthusian theories.  See Malthus

malthusian theory.definition: Malthus' theory that population increase would outpace increases in the means of subsistence; Malthusianism.  See Malthusian

malthusianism.definition: The system of Malthusian doctrines relating to population.  See Malthusian

maltin.definition: The fermentative principle of malt; malt diastase; also, a name given to various medicinal preparations made from or containing malt

malting.definition: The process of making, or of becoming malt

maltman.definition: A man whose occupation is to make malt

maltonic.definition: Of, pertaining to, or derived from, maltose; specif., designating an acid called also gluconic or dextronic acid. See Gluconic

maltose.definition: A crystalline disaccharide (C12H22O11) formed from starch by the action of diastase of malt, and the amylolytic ferment of saliva and pancreatic juice; called also maltobiose and malt sugar.  Chemically it is 4-O-α-D-glucopyranosyl-D-glucose.  It rotates the plane of polarized light further to the right than does dextrose and possesses a lower cupric oxide reducing power

maltreat.definition: To treat ill; to abuse; to treat roughly

maltreatment.definition: Cruel or inhumane treatment; ill usage; abuse

malva.definition: A genus of herbs and subshrubs including the mallows

malva neglecta.definition: The species name of the common mallow, an annual Old World plant with clusters of pink or white flowers; naturalized in U.S

malva sylvestris.definition: The species name of the tall mallow, an erect or decumbent Old World perennial with axillary clusters of rosy-purple flowers; introduced into the U. S
synonyms: Syn. -- tall mallow, high mallow, cheese, cheeseflower.

malvaceae.definition: A natural family of herbs and shrubs and some trees, including the mallows, cotton, and okra; the mallow family

malvaceous.definition: Pertaining to, or resembling, a natural family of plants (Malvaceae), of which the mallow is the type.  The cotton plant, hollyhock, and abutilon are of this family.  It was formerly classified as an order, and included the baobab and the silk-cotton trees.  The baobab and silk-cotton trees are now placed in the family Bombacaceae, which is included with the Malvaceae in the order Malvales

malvales.definition: A natural order of plants including the families Malvaceae, Bombacaceae, Elaeocarpaceae, Sterculiaceae, and Tiliaceae

malvasia.definition: A sweet grape used to make malmsey wine

malvastrum.definition: A genus of mallows characterized by red and yellow flowers often placed in other genera

malvaviscus.definition: A small genus of shrubs of Central and South America: wax mallows

malversation.definition: Evil conduct; fraudulent practices; misbehavior, corruption, or extortion in office

mama's boy.definition: A boy excessively attached to his mother; a boy lacking the usual masculine interests; also spelled mamma's boy

mamelon.definition: A rounded hillock; a rounded elevation or protuberance

mameluco.definition: A child born of a white father and Indian mother

mameluke.definition: One of a body of mounted soldiers recruited from slaves converted to Muslimism, who, during several centuries, had more or less control of the government of Egypt, until exterminated or dispersed by Mehemet Ali in 1811

mamma.definition: Mother; -- word of tenderness and familiarity
A glandular organ for secreting milk, characteristic of all mammals, but usually rudimentary in the male; a mammary gland; a breast; udder; bag

mammalia.definition: The highest class of Vertebrata.  The young are nourished for a time by milk, or an analogous fluid, secreted by the mammary glands of the mother

mammalian.definition: Of or pertaining to the Mammalia or mammals

mammaliferous.definition: Containing mammalian remains; -- said of certain strata

mammalogy.definition: The science which relates to mammals or the Mammalia. See Mammalia

mammary.definition: Of or pertaining to the mammae or breasts; as, the mammary arteries and veins

mammary gland.definition: The milk-secreting organ of female mammals

mammea.definition: A genus of American and Asiatic trees having edible one-seeded fruit

mammea americana.definition: The speciaes name for the mammee tree

mammee.definition: A fruit tree of tropical America, belonging to the genus Mammea (Mammea Americana); also, its fruit, called the mammee apple.  The latter is large, covered with a thick, tough ring, and contains a bright yellow pulp of a pleasant taste and fragrant scent.  It is often called mammee apple
synonyms: Syn. -- mammee apple, mammee, mamey, Mammea americana.

mammee apple.definition: A tropical American tree (Mammea americana) having edible fruit (the mammee apple) with a leathery rind
synonyms: Syn. -- mammee, mamey, mammee tree, Mammea americana.

mammee apple.definition: The globular or ovoid tropical fruit of the mammee tree (Mammea americana), having a thick russet leathery rind and juicy yellow or reddish flesh

mammet.definition: An idol; a puppet; a doll

mammiferous.definition: Having breasts; of, pertaining to, or derived from, the Mammalia

mammiform.definition: Having the form of a mamma (breast) or mammae

mammillary.definition: Of or pertaining to the mammilla, or nipple, or to the breast; resembling a mammilla; mammilloid
Composed of convex convex concretions, somewhat resembling the breasts in form; studded with small mammiform protuberances

mammillate.definition: Having small nipples, or small protuberances like nipples or mammae
Bounded like a nipple; -- said of the apex of some shells

mammilliform.definition: Having the form of a mammilla

mammilloid.definition: Like a mammilla or nipple; mammilliform

mammon.definition: Riches; wealth; the god of riches; riches, personified

mammonish.definition: Actuated or prompted by a devotion to money getting or the service of Mammon

mammonism.definition: Devotion to the pursuit of wealth; worldliness

mammonite.definition: One devoted to the acquisition of wealth or the service of Mammon

mammonization.definition: The process of making mammonish; the state of being under the influence of mammonism

mammose.definition: Having the form of the breast; breast-shaped

mammoth.definition: An extinct, hairy, maned elephant (Mammuthus primigenius formerly Elephas primigenius), of enormous size, remains of which are found in the northern parts of both continents.  The last of the race, in Europe, were coeval with prehistoric man
Resembling the mammoth in size; very large; gigantic; as, a mammoth ox

mammothrept.definition: A child brought up by its grandmother; a spoiled child

mammuthus.definition: An extinct genus comprising the mammoths

mammuthus primigenius.definition: The species name for the woolly mammoth, a very hairy mammoth common in colder portions of the Northern hemisphere

mammutidae.definition: An extinct natural family of mammals, comprising the mastodons

mammy.definition: A child's name for mamma, mother

mamoncillo.definition: A tropical American tree (Melicocca bijuga, or Melicocca bijugatus) bearing a small edible fruit with green leathery skin and sweet juicy translucent pulp
synonyms: Syn. -- Spanish lime, Spanish lime tree, honey berry, genip, ginep, Melicocca bijuga, Melicocca bijugatus.

mamzer.definition: A person born of relations between whom marriage was forbidden by the Mosaic law; a bastard

man.definition: A human being; -- opposed to beast
An adult male person; a grown-up male person, as distinguished from a woman or a child
The male portion of the human race
One possessing in a high degree the distinctive qualities of manhood; one having manly excellence of any kind
An adult male servant; also, a vassal; a subject

A term of familiar address at one time implying on the part of the speaker some degree of authority, impatience, or haste; as, Come, man, we 've no time to lose!  In the latter half of the 20th century it became used in a broader sense as simply a familiar and informal form of address, but is not used in business or formal situations; as, hey, man!  You want to go to a movie tonight?
A married man; a husband; -- correlative to wife
One, or any one, indefinitely; -- a modified survival of the Saxon use of man, or mon, as an indefinite pronoun
One of the piece with which certain games, as chess or draughts, are played
To supply with men; to furnish with a sufficient force or complement of men, as for management, service, defense, or the like; to guard; as, to man a ship, boat, or fort
To furnish with strength for action; to prepare for efficiency; to fortify
To furnish with a servant or servants
To wait on as a manservant

man and wife.definition: A man and woman who are married to each other; a married couple

man friday.definition: A person who contributes to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort or purpose; a devoted assistant

man hour.definition: The quantity of work which one person can perform in one hour; -- often an estimate made for the purpose of deciding whether to undertake a project, and sometimes used in accounting; as, it will take a hundred man-hours to write the program

man in the street.definition: An average person; as, the views of the man in the street

man jack.definition: A single individual person; as, every man jack of them

man of action.definition: A person who prefers to act rather than contemplate and gets things accomplished quickly an efficiently

man of affairs.definition: A person engaged in commercial or industrial business (especially an owner or executive)

man of letters.definition: A writer, especially one who writes for a living

man-at-arms.definition: A heavily armed and sometimes mounted soldier in medieval times

man-eater.definition: One who, or that which, has an appetite for human flesh; specifically, one of certain large sharks (esp. Carcharodon carcharias syn. Carcharodon Rondeleti); also, a lion or a tiger which has acquired the habit of feeding upon human flesh

man-eating shark.definition: A term applied to sharks that attack humans, especially the great white shark (Carcharodon carcharias), a large aggressive shark widespread in warm seas
synonyms: Syn. -- great white shark, white shark, man-eater, Carcharodon carcharias.

man-made.definition: Not of natural origin; prepared or made by humans; artificial; of substances, made by chemical reaction rather than extracted from a natural source; as, man-made fibers; man-made gems.  Opposed to natural

man-made fiber.definition: A fiber created from natural materials or by chemical processes

man-of-the-earth.definition: A long-rooted morning glory (Ipomoea leptophylla) of Western U. S
synonyms: Syn. -- man of the earth, Ipomoea leptophylla.

man-of-the-earth.definition: A tropical American prostrate or climbing herbaceous perennial (Ipomoea panurata or Ipomoea fastigiata) having an enormous starchy root; sometimes held to be source of the sweet potato
synonyms: Syn. -- wild potato vine, wild sweet potato vine, man of the earth, manroot, scammonyroot, Ipomoea panurata, Ipomoea fastigiata.

man-of-war.definition: A government vessel employed for the purposes of war, esp. one of large size; a ship of war

man-of-war bird.definition: The frigate bird, a long-billed warm-water seabird with wide wingspan and forked tail; also applied to the skua gulls, and to the wandering albatross

man-sized.definition: Calling for manly attributes; as, a man-sized job
Large enough to satisfy a man; as, a man-sized piece of cake

manacle.definition: A handcuff; a shackle for the hand or wrist; -- usually in the plural
To put handcuffs or other fastening upon, for confining the hands; to shackle; to confine; to restrain from the use of the limbs or natural powers

manage.definition: The handling or government of anything, but esp. of a horse; management; administration. See Manege
To have under control and direction; to conduct; to guide; to administer; to treat; to handle
to guide by careful or delicate treatment; to wield with address; to make subservient by artful conduct; to bring around cunningly to one's plans
To train in the manege, as a horse; to exercise in graceful or artful action
To treat with care; to husband
To direct affairs; to carry on business or affairs; to administer

manageability.definition: The state or quality of being manageable; manageableness

manageable.definition: Such as can be managed or used; suffering control; governable; tractable; subservient; as, a manageable horse

managed economy.definition: A non-market economy in which government intervention is important in allocating goods and resources and determining prices

management.definition: The act or art of managing; the manner of treating, directing, carrying on, or using, for a purpose; conduct; administration; guidance; control; as, the management of a family or of a farm; the management of a business enterprise; the management of state affairs
Judicious use of means to accomplish an end; conduct directed by art or address; skillful treatment; cunning practice; -- often in a bad sense
The collective body of those who manage or direct any enterprise or interest; the board of managers

management consultant.definition: An adviser to business about efficient management practices

management personnel.definition: Personnel having ovrall planning and direction responsibilities

manager.definition: One who manages; a conductor or director; as, the manager of a theater
A person who conducts business or household affairs with economy and frugality; a good economist

managerial.definition: Of or pertaining to management or a manager; as, managerial qualities

managership.definition: The office or position of a manager

managery.definition: Management; manner of using; conduct; direction

managing director.definition: A person who manages a busness though not the owner or chief executive

managing editor.definition: The editor in charge of all editorial activities of a newspaper or magazine

manakin.definition: Any one of numerous small birds belonging to Pipra, Manacus, and other genera of the family Pipridae.  They are mostly natives of Central and South America.  Some are bright-colored, and others have the wings and tail curiously ornamented.  The name is sometimes applied to related birds of other families

manannan.definition: The Irish god of the sea; son of Ler

manatee.definition: Any species of Trichechus, a genus of sirenians; -- called also sea cow

manation.definition: The act of issuing or flowing out

manbote.definition: A sum paid to a lord as a pecuniary compensation for killing his man (that is, his vassal, servant, or tenant)

manchester terrier.definition: A breed of short-haired black-and-tan terrier developed in Manchester England

manchet.definition: Fine white bread; a loaf of fine bread

manchineel.definition: A euphorbiaceous tree (Hippomane Mancinella) of tropical America, having a poisonous and blistering milky juice, and poisonous acrid fruit somewhat resembling an apple

manchu.definition: Of or pertaining to Manchuria or its inhabitants

mancipate.definition: To enslave; to bind; to restrict

manciple.definition: A steward; a purveyor, particularly of a college or Inn of Court

mancus.definition: An old Anglo Saxon coin both of gold and silver, and of variously estimated values.  The silver mancus was equal to about one shilling of modern English money

mandamus.definition: A writ issued by a superior court and directed to some inferior tribunal, or to some corporation or person exercising authority, commanding the performance of some specified duty

mandarin.definition: A Chinese public officer or nobleman; a civil or military official in China and Annam
A powerful government official or bureaucrat, especially one who is pedantic and has a strong sense of his own importance and privelege

A member of an influential, powerful or elite group, espcially within artistic or intellectual circles; -- used especially of elder members who are traditionalist or conservative about their specialties
The form of the Chinese language spoken by members of the Chinese Imperial Court an officials of the empire
Any of several closely related dialects of the Chinese language spoken by a mojority of the population of China, the standard variety of which is spoken in the region around Beijing

A small flattish reddish-orange loose-skinned orange, with an easily separable rind. It is thought to be of Chinese origin, and is counted a distinct species (Citrus reticulata formerly Citrus nobilis); called also mandarin orange and tangerine

mandarin duck.definition: A showy crested Asiatic duck (Aix galericulata, formerly Dendronessa galericulata), often domesticated, and regarded by the Chinese as an emblem of conjugal affection

mandarin orange.definition: A shrub or small tree (Citrus reticulata) having flattened globose fruit with very sweet aromatic pulp and thin yellow-orange to flame-orange rind that is loose and easily removed; native to Southeast Asia

mandarinate.definition: The collective body of officials or persons of rank in China

mandarinic.definition: Appropriate or peculiar to a mandarin

mandarining.definition: The process of giving an orange color to goods formed of animal tissue, as silk or wool, not by coloring matter, but by producing a certain change in the fiber by the action of dilute nitric acid

mandarinism.definition: A government by mandarins (senses 1 or 2); character or spirit of the mandarins{2}

mandatary.definition: One to whom a command or charge is given; hence, specifically, a person to whom the pope has, by his prerogative, given a mandate or order for his benefice
One who undertakes to discharge a specific business commission; a mandatory

mandate.definition: An official or authoritative command, order, or authorization from a superior official to a subordinate; an order or injunction; a commission; a judicial precept

An authorization to carry out a specific public policy, given by the electorate to their representatives; -- it is considered to be implied by the election of a candidate by a significant margin after that candidate has campaigned with that policy as a prominent element of the campaign platform
Authorization by a multinational body to a nation to administer the government and affairs of a territory, usually a former colony; as, termination of the British mandate in Palestine
A rescript of the pope, commanding an ordinary collator to put the person therein named in possession of the first vacant benefice in his collation
A contract by which one employs another to manage any business for him.  By the Roman law, it must have been gratuitous

mandator.definition: A director; one who gives a mandate or order
The person who employs another to perform a mandate

mandatory.definition: Not optional; not able to be modified or disregarded; as, seven mandatory clauses in the contract

mandelic.definition: Pertaining to an acid first obtained from benzoic aldehyde (oil of better almonds), as a white crystalline substance; -- called also phenyl glycolic acid

mandible.definition: The bone, or principal bone, of the lower jaw; the inferior maxilla; -- also applied to either the upper or the lower jaw in the beak of birds
The anterior pair of mouth organs of insects, crustaceaus, and related animals, whether adapted for biting or not. See Illust. of Diptera

mandibular.definition: Of or pertaining to a mandible; like a mandible

mandibular joint.definition: The joint between the head of the lower jawbone and the temporal bone

mandibulate.definition: Provided with mandibles adapted for biting, as many insects

mandibuliform.definition: Having the form of a mandible; -- said especially of the maxillae of an insect when hard and adapted for biting

mandibulohyoid.definition: Pertaining both to the mandibular and the hyoid arch, or situated between them

mandil.definition: A loose outer garment worn the 16th and 17th centuries

mandingos.definition: An extensive and powerful tribe of West African negroes

mandola.definition: An instrument closely resembling the mandolin, but of larger size and tuned lower

mandolin.definition: A small and beautifully shaped instrument resembling the lute

mandragora.definition: A genus of plants; the mandrake. See Mandrake, 1

mandragorite.definition: One who habitually intoxicates himself with a narcotic obtained from mandrake

mandrake.definition: A low plant (Mandragora officinarum) of the Nightshade family, having a fleshy root, often forked, and supposed to resemble a man.  It was therefore supposed to have animal life, and to cry out when pulled up.  All parts of the plant are strongly narcotic.  It is found in the Mediterranean region
The May apple (Podophyllum peltatum). See May apple under May, and Podophyllum

mandrake root.definition: The root of the mandrake plant; used medicinally or as a narcotic; as a substance it is also called mandrake

mandrel.definition: A bar of metal inserted in the work to shape it, or to hold it, as in a lathe, during the process of manufacture; an arbor

mandril.definition: any of various shafts that rotate or serve as axes for larger rotating parts

mandrill.definition: A large West African baboon (Papio sphinx syn. Mandrillus sphinx, formerly Cynocephalus mormon syn. Papio mormon).  The adult male has, on the sides of the nose, large, naked, grooved swellings, conspicuously striped with blue and red.  It is an endangered species

manduca.definition: A genus of moths whose larvae are hornworms

manducable.definition: Such as can be chewed; fit to be eaten

manducate.definition: To masticate; to chew; to eat

manducatory.definition: Pertaining to, or employed in, chewing

manducus.definition: A grotesque mask, representing a person chewing or grimacing, worn in processions and by comic actors on the stage

mane.definition: The long and heavy hair growing on the upper side of, or about, the neck of some quadrupedal animals, as the horse, the lion, etc. See Illust. of Horse

maned sheep.definition: A type of wild sheep (Ammotragus lervia) of northern Africa; called also Barbary sheep and aoudad
synonyms: Syn. -- aoudad, arui, audad, Barbary sheep, Ammotragus lervia.

maned wolf.definition: A reddish-gray wolf (Canis rufus or Canis niger) of Southwestern North America
synonyms: Syn. -- red wolf, Canis rufus, Canis niger.

manege.definition: The art of horsemanship, or of training horses
A school for teaching horsemanship, and for training horses

maneh.definition: A Hebrew weight for gold or silver, being one hundred shekels of gold and sixty shekels of silver

manequin.definition: An artist's model of wood or other material

manes.definition: The benevolent spirits of the dead, especially of dead ancestors, regarded as family deities and protectors

manesheet.definition: A covering placed over the upper part of a horse's head

maneuver.definition: Management; dexterous movement; specif., a military or naval evolution, movement, or change of position
Management with address or artful design; adroit proceeding; stratagem
To perform a movement or movements in military or naval tactics; to make changes in position with the intention of getting an advantage in attack or defense
To make changes in one's approach to solving a problem, so as to achieve maximum advantage in a changing situation; -- used especially in competitive situations, as in politics, diplomacy, or sports
To manage with address or art; to scheme
To change the positions of, as of troops of ships

manful.definition: Showing manliness, or manly spirit; hence, brave, courageous, resolute, noble

mangabey.definition: Any one of several African monkeys of the genus Cercocebus, as the sooty mangabey (Cercocebus fuliginosus), which is sooty black

manganese.definition: An element obtained by reduction of its oxide, as a hard, grayish white metal, fusible with difficulty (melting point 1244° C), but easily oxidized.  Its ores occur abundantly in nature as the minerals pyrolusite, manganite, etc.  Symbol Mn.  Atomic number 25; Atomic weight 54.938 [C=12.011]

manganese bronze.definition: A brass alloy having from 1 to 4 percent of manganese added to harden it; made by adding manganese to the copper and zinc used in brass

manganese steel.definition: Cast steel containing a considerable percentage (10-14) of manganese, which makes it very hard and tough and highly resistant to wear. See Alloy steel, above

manganic.definition: Of, pertaining to resembling, or containing, manganese; specif., designating compounds in which manganese has a higher valence as contrasted with manganous compounds.  Cf. Manganous

manganic acid.definition: A dibasic acid H2MnO4, formed from manganese, analogous to sulphuric acid; it is found only in solution and in manganate salts

manganite.definition: One of the oxides of manganese; -- called also gray manganese ore.  It occurs in brilliant steel-gray or iron-black crystals, also massive
A compound of manganese dioxide with a metallic oxide; so called as though derived from the hypothetical manganous acid

manganous.definition: Of, pertaining to, designating, those compounds of manganese in which the element has a lower valence as contrasted with manganic compounds; as, manganous oxide

mangcorn.definition: A mixture of wheat and rye, or other species of grain

mange.definition: The scab or itch in cattle, dogs, and other beasts

mangel-wurzel.definition: A kind of large field beet (Beta macrorhiza), used as food for cattle, -- by some considered a mere variety of the ordinary beet. See Beet

manger.definition: A trough or open box in which fodder is placed for horses or cattle to eat
The fore part of the deck, having a bulkhead athwart ships high enough to prevent water which enters the hawse holes from running over it

synonyms: Syn. -- mangy, threadbare; worn-out, seedy, squalid.

mangifera.definition: genus of tropical trees native to Asia bearing fleshy fruit

manginess.definition: The condition or quality of being mangy

mangle.definition: To cut or bruise with repeated blows or strokes, making a ragged or torn wound, or covering with wounds; to tear in cutting; to cut in a bungling manner; to lacerate; to mutilate
To mutilate or injure, in making, doing, or performing; as, to mangle a piece of music or a recitation
A machine for smoothing linen or cotton cloth, as sheets, tablecloths, napkins, and clothing, by roller pressure, often with heated rollers
To smooth with a mangle, as damp linen or cloth

mangler.definition: One who mangles or tears in cutting; one who mutilates any work in doing it
One who smooths with a mangle

mango.definition: The fruit of the mango tree. It is rather larger than an apple, and of an ovoid shape. Some varieties are fleshy and luscious, and others tough and tasting of turpentine. The green fruit is pickled for market
A green muskmelon stuffed and pickled

mango tree.definition: An East Indian tree of the genus Mangifera (Mangifera Indica), related to the cashew and the sumac.  It grows to a large size, and produces a large oval smooth-skinned fruit which is the mango of commerce.  It is now cultivated in tropical America

mangonel.definition: A military engine formerly used for throwing stones and javelins

mangonism.definition: The art of mangonizing, or setting off to advantage

mangonist.definition: A slave dealer; also, a strumpet

mangonize.definition: To furbish up for sale; to set off to advantage

mangosteen.definition: A tree of the East Indies of the genus Garcinia (Garcinia Mangostana) with thick leathery leaves.  The tree grows to the height of eighteen feet, and bears fruit also called mangosteen, of the size of a small apple, the pulp of which is very delicious food

mangrove.definition: The name of one or two trees of the genus Rhizophora (Rhizophora Mangle, and Rhizophora mucronata, the last doubtfully distinct) inhabiting muddy shores of tropical regions, where they spread by emitting aerial roots, which fasten in the saline mire and eventually become new stems. The seeds also send down a strong root while yet attached to the parent plant
